title: Appropriate use of Comic Sans
content: Today I was in the court of my town and I see some beautiful notice set in Comic Sans all caps (size 100 points). I can't imagine a font most suitable to italian justice.
author: daniele capo

comments.content:
I guess they need to read [**Typography for Lawyers**](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135304/http:/www.typographyforlawyers.com/)...

;-D
I saw Comic Sans at the Seattle Municipal Courthouse, for that notice that tells the public how to run their stuff through the metal detector. Someone must've thought it would look real friendly...

The last police report I filed in Madrid had a mix of Arial, Times New Roman, and, you guessed it, Comic Sans. I thought they had some too on my tax return but I just checked and it doesn't. Heh, at least one branch of the government has it right. My pre-application form for the TED program at UAM also sported it.

_«El futuro es una línea tan fina que apenas nos damos cuenta de pintarla nosotros mismos». (La Luz Oscura, por Javier Guerrero)_
Well, so it isn't an italian problem. “Tutto il mondo è paese”
